title: Part 2
content:
Part 2

AFTER SENDING KAMOGAWA off in a taxi, I started walking alone on the dark snowy road.

I wanted to cool down my heated head now that I was alone.

I had to think about the future. But before that, I needed to learn everything and settle things within myself. I called that man on my phone.

It was late at night, but I was certain the call would connect.

"Tsukishiro, answer me. Why did Naoe give up his position to follow Kijima?"

"You say such interesting things the moment I receive your call."

"You should know everything, right?"

"Until now, Naoe-sensei had prided himself on being the best politician. However, he realized that Kijima-sensei was someone who would surpass him."

"Ridiculous."

"Although they have pretty different ideals, they surprisingly have a lot in common."

"And… you think that would convince me?"

"The existence of the White Room you were involved in isn't something Kijima-sensei would be pleased with."

"What are you talking about? That man has ANHS. It can also be launched as a second political measure."

"Indeed, that's one of his flagship political strategies. However, at the same time, he had been quietly advancing a new plan that's similar to the White Room. In other words, the second measure has already started moving. Coming forward with the plan prematurely isn't desirable for him."

"…So, that's why Naoe cut me off…"

"It's unclear at which point, but the White Room had reached Kijima-sensei's ears. He had discussions with Naoe-sensei, and as one of the conditions for putting a stop to the project, you could say that Naoe-sensei made Kijima-sensei promise him a future position."

Kijima was also considering a plan similar to the White Room, huh?

"That's not all. You were far more capable than Naoe-sensei had imagined. In recent years, he relied on you a lot, but at the same time, didn't you think there were a lot of unreasonable demands?"

"…Yes."

"That's because he was afraid of you. Eventually, he hoped you would fail rather than continue using you. However, you didn't fail. Well, it's not like you never failed, but you managed well, erased traces of your failures, and kept a low profile. That alone is a considerable skill. Naoe-sensei wasn't raising you to be at the top. He hoped that when his son becomes the country's leader, you would support him as his right-hand man. Naoe-sensei's only miscalculation, despite being someone who could see through anything, was your boundless ambition—he failed to perceive it."

In another ten years, even Naoe wouldn't be able to completely crush me.

He took action to prevent that in advance.

Whether it was a parting gift to his son or a bomb for me, who might threaten his son.

"Are you satisfied with the answer?"

"Why are you speaking so openly?"

"If you were the type of person who would meet their downfall here, I wouldn't have spoken. However, my intuition tells me otherwise. Eventually, you'll return to the public stage, stronger than ever. That's why I spoke."

"What a smart decision. But of course, you plan to smoothly maneuver through things no matter how things turn out, right?"

"A foolish question."

This man wouldn't commit solely to me. He could become an ally or an enemy to anyone.

If deemed incompetent, he would discard me in an instant.

"You can sell my information to Naoe or anyone you like. In return, I will get information from you. It's preferable for both sides to keep each other under surveillance."

"Understood."

"It looks like we're going to have a long relationship, Tsukishiro."

"I hope so. Please contact me anytime you have a request, Ayanokouji-sensei."

With that, Tsukishiro hung up the phone.

Yes, that's right—I'm not finished here.

From now on, I will thoroughly fortify myself and accumulate power to protect my own life.

And at the same time, I will create soldiers in the White Room.[1]

•

Located in the middle of a luxury, top-class high-rise hotel in Tokyo, two hundred meters tall with fifty stories above the ground, was a banquet floor. I arrived a little before the scheduled time and was lost in thought in the ascending elevator.

It was a three-hour rental, serving food to about sixty people, costing about three million yen.

It might've seemed trivial, but considering the bleak financial outlook, it wasn't cheap.

The party had been growing in scale every year since the facility started operating.

I had to solicit more donations than ever before.

Naoe's influence had turned many wealthy backers against me.

From two hundred to sixty, it was clear from the decrease of supporters.

Money, I need billions of yen.

Today, all I needed here was my own skill.

My reflection in the giant elevator's fully glass sides met my eyes.

I've aged quite a bit.

Looking back, I was able to calmly reflect on my aging.

It was a miracle that I had been continuing to operate the White Room.

But I'm still halfway through the journey.

It had been a while since I was expelled from the political world, but the fire of ambition within me was burning brighter than ever.

I arrived at the designated floor and stepped out of the elevator into the waiting room.

Having lost the politician title, I was now treated as a former politician.

Normally, my influence would've decreased significantly.

However, my title as the head of the White Room operation was steadily gaining power.

Otherwise, the financiers wouldn't gather here.

"Ayanokouji-sensei, it's almost time."

"Yeah."

Although I had many thoughts, solving the financial issues was my top priority.

The larger the scale, the more enormous the maintenance costs for operating the White Room became.

In order to sustain it, I had to transform disposable money into productive investment.

"Sorry to keep you waiting."

"You seem restless. How many times have you gone to the bathroom now?"

Tabuchi, who had returned to the waiting room, sat down in his chair and began to nervously tap his left foot up and down.

"When will you get rid of that nervous habit?"

"Sorry, but I can't help feeling anxious about missing this chance…"

Indeed, if funds ran short, the White Room project would hit a significant snag.

It'd be best if it were merely a temporary freeze, but stopping the children's education would be a fatal blow.

It would be like the chicks we had raised dying from a pathogen.

"Listen, Tabuchi. We can't ignore the fact that there's no way out. However, that's exactly why we have to take a bold step forward without looking back. Think about what you'd do if we fall only after we've fallen."

As the speed of his trembling left foot slowed, Tabuchi looked up at me.

"You're strong, Ayanokouji-sensei."

"Considering the crises I've faced before, this is nothing. I was exploited by Naoe, the White Room Project was ordered to be suspended, and I lost my title as a politician."

Yet, I never stopped walking.

I prided myself on having walked a path of hell that I couldn't tell others about.

Aside from people like Naoe and Kijima, it wasn't easy for mere politicians to even meet me.

Although I had lost my politician title, there was no doubt that I had surpassed my former self.

Eventually, Tabuchi's trembling stopped, and he clenched his fist firmly.

I had to show those who believed in and followed the White Room that they wouldn't regret it.

"Do you think we can succeed today?"

"Of course. Do you know what the most powerful weapon that anybody can easily use is?"

"…What is it?"

"It's a 'lie.' Of course, it's a double-edged sword that comes with risks. However, a lie has power."

"A… lie?"

"Politics is a world where some have risen to the top with just one lie. That's how powerful a lie can be."

Of course, a lie only had meaning if it was skillfully managed.

"We'll make full use of that weapon. Let's go, Tabuchi. This is the White Room's moment of truth."

"Yes, Sir!"
